page.title: 17Thornhill Golf Course
page.content: In the last years of the nineteenth century a nine hole golf course was built in Blacknest farm.It remained a nine hole course for 70 years until the 1960s when the Stevens family sold the farm to the Duke of Buccleuch.He made it into an 18 hole course,and he turned an old house into a bar and club house for members.The course wsa finally completed in 1972,12 years after it begun.In memory,a rock was placed on top of the hill beside the first hole,with a metal plate which had the dates of completion of both courses on it.There are about 150 members today and 21 life members.The par for the course is ladies 74 and men 71.The ladies par is more than the mens.The distance for the ladies is 4.896km and for the men 6.120km.Money for ladies membership Â£63.Mens membership is Â£69.Junior Â£31.
